intro: Malanea cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical malanea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Malanea cylindrica is typically found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
